DataElement.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Uniform Resource Locator ISO21090.TEL.URL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A key document that, together with the study protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), prospectively defines the study's Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) infrastructure and, in particular, the DMC's responsibilities; stipulates who sees blinded results and who sees unblinded results; and establishes a method for communication between the DMC and the sponsor. A complete or local reference to a website, ftp, file path or other location from which the document contents can be retrieved. NOTE(S): Local references should only be used when communicating between systems capable of resolving the local reference.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Uniform Resource Locator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A Uniform Resource Locator is an Internet address which tells a browser where to find an Internet resource. (from http://www.computeruser.com)

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).
A group delegated to consider matters concerning clinical studies or trials.
A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A Uniform Resource Locator is an Internet address which tells a browser where to find an Internet resource. (from http://www.computeruser.com)

Concepts.definition: The global address of documents and other resources on the World Wide Web.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains TEL points to resource with binary content.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
